[{"id":"JT-47737","entityId":"25-2025140","jiraId":null,"field":[{"name":"projectShortName","value":"JT"},{"name":"numberInProject","value":"47737"},{"name":"summary","value":"Enum field with default empty value throws error"},{"name":"description","value":"
When creating a custom enum field and setting the empty value to be No Value and Can Be Empty, I get a warning the the field is required. This doesn't actually seem to be the case since, when editing an issue, it allows me to save the issue without inputting a value.

There is a long-standing issue about completing user name in the command window. The situation is even worse while adding new watchers via Watchers popup: since usernames aren't shown in the popup I cannot tell which user in the list is from our team even if I know his username:

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1529062791715,"updated":null,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]},{"id":"27-2914591","author":"nik","authorFullName":"Nikolay Chashnikov","issueId":"JT-46254","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"
Maxim Erekhinskiy This won't help, see JT-13681. A quick example: I've just tried to add you as a watcher to an issue, and the following was shown:

Given that userpics look similar I suppose all the three accounts belong to you and not to you namesakes, but which of them is the main account? I suppose two of these are some testing accounts and you'll probably miss notification if I select one of them. And how login names would help here?
","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1529067614102,"updated":1529067634760,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":false,"replies":[]}],"tag":[]}]
